H0.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Missionary

H1.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Philosopher

H2.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Leader

H3.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Writer

A4.text: Paul spread the teachings of Jesus in the first-century AD and founded several Christian communities in Asia Minor and Europe.

A5.text: The main sources of information on Paul's life and works are Paul's letters and the Acts of the Apostles in the New Testament.

A6.text: Most scholars believe that Paul actually wrote seven of the thirteen Pauline epistles (Galatians, Romans, 1 Corinthians, 2 Corinthians, Philemon, Philippians, 1 Thessalonians), while three of the epistles in Paul's name are widely seen as pseudepigraphic (1 Timothy, 2 Timothy, and Titus).

A7.text: Paul explicitly states in multiple epistles that he used secretaries, sometimes mentioned by name, a potential explanation for seemingly non-Pauline epistles.
